item.title: Pressure Regulating and Shutoff Valve Closed Position Indicating System

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided associated valve is verified to be operative once each flight day.

numlitem.para: If the left or right Pressure Regulating and Shutoff Valve Position Switch is failed in the CLOSED position, the APU Shutoff Valve will not be commanded closed when engine bleed is turned ON. Select APU or APU bleed OFF before turning the affected engine bleed ON.

If the left Pressure Regulating Shutoff Valve Position Switch is failed Open, the APU Shutoff Valve will be commanded closed. APU bleed air for engine start will not be available. Start the left engine with ground air and cross-bleed start the right engine. The APU will not be available as a pneumatic source during the flight.

If the right Pressure Regulating and Shutoff Valve Position Switch is failed OPEN, the APU can be used to start the left engine and bleed air from the left engine can be used to cross-bleed start the right engine. APU bleed air can be used as normal on the left system only with the bleed air isolation switch off.

placard.para: Placard near Bleed Air Supply Module (10259) on P5 panel "ENGINE BLEED AIR OFF LIGHT(S) INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: Select APU or APU BLEED OFF.
Ensure the bleed air isolation valve is closed.
Select associated L/R BLEED AIR switch light to the ON position.
Observe BLEED AIR DUCT PRESS on affected side is normal (approximately 20 psi).
Select associated L/R BLEED AIR switch light to the OFF position.
Observe BLEED AIR DUCT PRESS on affected side is 0.
